name: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps
mapping: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps Default Mappings
description: This plugin ingests event logs (Application and Page) into the Governance log page of the Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps platform. It supports the ingestion of CEF formatted logs.

configuration.label: Portal URL
configuration.description: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps portal URL, in which the traffic logs are to be ingested. (exclude http(s)://).

configuration.label: Authentication Method
configuration.description: The authentication method used to access the Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps.

configuration.label: Tenant ID
configuration.description: Tenant ID of your Azure application. The Tenant ID can be found from App registrations > App Name > Overview page. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Client ID
configuration.description: Client ID of your Azure application. The Client ID can be found from App registrations > App Name > Overview page. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Client Secret
configuration.description: Client Secret of your Azure application. The Client Secret can be generated from App registrations > App Name > Certificates & secrets page. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: API Token
configuration.description: API token for authentication in the Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps portal. The API token can be generated from the Settings > Cloud Apps > API Tokens page. It is required only if the 'Legacy Method (API Token)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Data Source
configuration.description: The data source where traffic logs from CLS are to be uploaded. The data source can be found at Settings > Cloud Apps > Cloud Discovery > Automatic Log Upload.
